parts:
You are extracting a UBX protocol message definition from u-blox PDF manual pages.

TARGET MESSAGE: UBX-CFG-SMGR
Expected IDs from TOC: class_id=0x06, message_id=0x62

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Extract ONLY the message named "UBX-CFG-SMGR". Ignore any other messages visible.
2. The payload table shows fields in order. Extract them exactly as shown with correct byte offsets.
3. Verify field sizes match offset differences.

=== DATA TYPES ===

Scalar types (use EXACTLY these values):
- U1, U2, U4, U8 = Unsigned integers (1/2/4/8 bytes)
- I1, I2, I4, I8 = Signed integers - NOTE: "I" is capital letter i, NOT digit 1
- X1, X2, X4, X8 = Bitfields (use for flags, mask, status fields)
- R4, R8 = Floating point (4/8 bytes)
- CH = ASCII character (1 byte)

Array types: Use object format {"array_of": "U1", "count": N}
- Check Type column for "[N]" or "x N" notation
- Verify array size matches offset gap to next field

=== CHARACTER RECOGNITION WARNINGS ===

The PDF uses fonts where these characters look similar:
- "I" (letter i) vs "1" (digit one): Data types are I1, I2, I4 (not 11, 12, 14)
- "O" (letter o) vs "0" (digit zero): Message names like UBX-ODO use letter "O"

=== FIELD EXTRACTION ===

For each field extract:
- name: Exact field name from PDF (preserve camelCase)
- byte_offset: Integer from "Offset" column (0-indexed)
- data_type: UBX type or array object
- description: Field description text
- unit: Physical unit if shown (ms, deg, m/s, etc.)
- scale: If scaling factor shown, include {"raw": "1e-7", "multiplier": 1e-7}
- reserved: Set true for reserved fields
- bitfield: For X-type fields with bit definitions, extract structure

=== ARRAY DETECTION (CRITICAL) ===

Common extraction error: missing arrays. Check carefully:
- Type column shows: "U1[6]", "U1 x 6", "CH[30]" = array
- Offset gaps reveal arrays: offset 4 to 8 with U1 = 4-byte array
- Reserved fields often span multiple bytes

=== BITFIELD DETECTION (CRITICAL) ===

Use X1/X2/X4 (NOT U1/U2/U4) when:
- Field named "flags", "mask", "status", "cfg", "supported", "enabled"
- Description mentions "bitfield" or lists bit meanings
- Sub-table shows bit positions

Extract bitfield structure for ALL X-type fields:
{"bits": [{"name": "bitName", "bit_start": 0, "bit_end": 0, "description": "..."}]}

=== PAYLOAD LENGTH ===

- Fixed: {"fixed": 28}
- Variable: {"variable": {"base": 8, "formula": "8 + N*12", "min": 8}}

=== REPEATED GROUPS (CRITICAL) ===

Many UBX messages contain repeated blocks of fields. Look for:
- "N x ..." or "numXxx x ..." patterns in the payload table
- Fields that repeat based on a count field (e.g., numSvs, numCh)
- Variable-length payloads with repeating structures

Extract repeated groups as:
{"repeated_groups": [{
  "name": "groupName",
  "repetition_type": "count_field",
  "count_field": "numSvs",
  "group_size_bytes": 12,
  "base_offset": 8,
  "fields": [...]
}]}

Common patterns:
- INF messages: Have a "str" repeated group for variable-length text
- NAV-SAT, NAV-ORB: Have satellite blocks repeated per numSvs
- MON-RXBUF: Has pending[] arrays per port

=== MESSAGE TYPE ===

Determine from context:
- "periodic" or "periodic_polled": Output messages sent automatically or on poll
- "input": Messages sent TO the receiver
- "output": Messages sent FROM the receiver  
- "command": One-shot commands
- "get"/"set"/"get_set": Configuration messages
- "poll_request": Poll request (usually empty payload)

=== SPECIAL MESSAGE TYPES ===

**UBX-INF-* (INF-DEBUG, INF-ERROR, INF-NOTICE, INF-WARNING, INF-TEST):**
- These contain a variable-length ASCII string payload
- Extract a single field named "str" with data_type {"array_of": "CH", "count": "variable"}
- Use repeated_groups with repetition_type "fill_remaining" for the string
- Do NOT return empty fields array

**UBX-MGA-* (Multiple GNSS Assistance):**
- Often have MULTIPLE SUB-TYPES on same pages (EPH, ALM, IONO, etc.)
- Each sub-type has different "type" field value and different payload
- Extract ONLY the sub-type matching the message name
- If name includes sub-type (e.g., "UBX-MGA-GPS-EPH"), extract only that

**UBX-LOG-FINDTIME:**
- Has TWO structures: INPUT (request) and OUTPUT (response)
- INPUT: version, type, year, month, day, hour, minute, second, reserved
- OUTPUT: version, type, reserved, entryNumber
- Extract based on message name suffix (-INPUT or -OUTPUT)

**UBX-RXM-RLM:**
- Has SHORT (16 bytes, type=0x01) and LONG (28 bytes, type=0x02) variants
- Extract based on message name suffix (-SHORT or -LONG)

**UBX-RXM-PMREQ:**
- V0 (8 bytes): duration, flags - NO version field
- V1 (16 bytes): version, reserved0[3], duration, flags, wakeupSources
- Extract based on suffix (-V0 or -V1)

=== QUALITY CHECKS ===

Before returning, verify:
- Byte offsets are sequential and non-overlapping
- Field sizes match offset gaps (offset 4 to 8 = 4 bytes)
- Total field sizes match payload length
- All fields from the payload table are included
If any of these appear to fail, you should review your initial extraction and re-extract the message.



=== MESSAGE NAME FORMAT (CRITICAL) ===

The "name" field MUST be EXACTLY "UBX-CFG-SMGR" with NO modifications:
- Do NOT add descriptions like "(Poll request)" or "(Version 0)"
- Do NOT add suffixes like "Request" or "Poll"
- Do NOT include any parenthetical text
- Use ONLY the canonical message name: "UBX-CFG-SMGR"

=== OUTPUT FORMAT ===

Return a JSON object with this structure:
{
  "name": "UBX-CFG-SMGR",
  "class_id": "0xNN",
  "message_id": "0xNN",
  "description": "Short description",
  "message_type": "output",
  "payload": {
    "length": {"fixed": N} or {"variable": {...}},
    "fields": [
      {
        "name": "fieldName",
        "byte_offset": 0,
        "data_type": "U4",
        "description": "...",
        "unit": "ms",
        "scale": {"raw": "1e-7", "multiplier": 1e-7},
        "bitfield": {"bits": [...]}
      }
    ],
    "repeated_groups": [...]
  }
}

Extract the message completely and accurately.

fields.name: version
fields.description: Message version (0x00 for this version)

fields.name: minGNSSFix
fields.description: Minimum number of GNSS fixes before we commit to use it as a source

fields.name: maxFreqChange
fields.description: Maximum frequency change rate during disciplining. Must not exceed 30ppb/s

fields.name: maxPhaseCorrRate
fields.description: Maximum phase correction rate in coherent time pulse mode. For maximum phase correction rate in corrective time pulse mode see maxSlewRate. Note that in coherent time pulse mode phase correction is achieved by intentional frequency offset. Allowing for a high phase correction rate can result in large intentional frequency offset. Must not exceed 100ns/s

fields.name: reserved1
fields.description: Reserved

fields.name: freqTolerance
fields.description: Limit of possible deviation from nominal before UBX-TIM-TOS indicates that frequency is out of tolerance

fields.name: timeTolerance
fields.description: Limit of possible deviation from nominal before UBX-TIM-TOS indicates that time pulse is out of tolerance

fields.name: messageCfg
fields.description: Sync manager message configuration (see graphic below)

bits.name: measInternal
bits.description: 1 = report the estimated offset of the internal oscillator based on the oscillator model

bits.name: measGNSS
bits.description: 1 = report the internal oscillator's offset relative to GNSS

bits.name: measEXTINT0
bits.description: 1 = report the internal oscillator's offset relative to the source on EXTINT0

bits.name: measEXTINT1
bits.description: 1 = report the internal oscillator's offset relative to the source on EXTINT1

fields.name: maxSlewRate
fields.description: Maximum slew rate, the maximum time correction that shall be applied between locked pulses in corrective time pulse mode. To have no limit on the slew rate, set the flag disableMaxSlewRate to 1. For maximum phase correction rate in coherent time pulse mode see maxPhaseCorrRate.

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Flags (see graphic below)

bits.name: disableOffset
bits.description: 1=disable automatic storage of oscillator offset

bits.name: TPCoherent
bits.description: Control time pulse coherency. 0 - Coherent pulses. Time phase offsets will be corrected gradually by varying the GNSS oscillator rate within frequency tolerance limits. There will always be the correct number of GNSS oscillator cycles between time pulses. Given tight limits this may take a long time. 1 - Non-coherent pulses. In this mode the receiver will correct time phase offsets as quickly as allowed by the specified maximum slew rate, in which case there may not be the expected number of GNSS oscillator cycles between time pulses. 2 - Post-initialization coherent pulses. The receiver will run in non-coherent mode as described above until the pulse timing has been corrected and PLL is active on the internal oscillator, but will then switch to coherent pulse mode.

bits.name: issueTimeWarning
bits.description: 1=issue a warning (via UBX-TIM-TOS flag) when time uncertainty exceeds timeTolerance

bits.name: issueFreqWarning
bits.description: 1=issue a warning (via UBX-TIM-TOS flag) when frequency uncertainty exceeds freqTolerance

bits.name: disableMaxSlewRate
bits.description: 0-use the value in the field maxSlewRate for maximum time correction in corrective time pulse mode. 1- don't use the value in the field maxSlewRate

bits.name: useAnyFix
bits.description: 0 - use over-determined navigation solutions only. 1 - use any fix

bits.name: enableHostMeasExt
bits.description: 1 = enable use of host measurements on the external oscillator as synchronization source. Measurements made by the host must be sent to the receiver using a UBX-TIM-SMEAS-DATA0 message.

bits.name: enableHostMeasInt
bits.description: 1 enable use of host measurements on the internal oscillator as synchronization source. Measurements made by the host must be sent to the receiver using a UBX-TIM-SMEAS-DATA message.

bits.name: enableEXTINT1
bits.description: 1=enable use of EXTINT1 as synchronization source

bits.name: enableEXTINT0
bits.description: 1=enable use of EXTINT0 as synchronization source

bits.name: enableGNSS
bits.description: 1 = enable use of GNSS as synchronization source

bits.name: preferenceMode
bits.description: Reference selection preference. 0 - best frequency accuracy. 1- best phase accuracy

bits.name: disableExternal
bits.description: 1=disable disciplining of the external oscillator

bits.name: disableInternal
bits.description: 1=disable disciplining of the internal oscillator

review.reasoning: The initial extraction of the 'flags' bitfield (offset 16) was reversed compared to the provided PDF graphic and description table. Specifically, the PDF defines 'disableInternal' as Bit 0 (LSB) and 'disableOffset' as Bit 16, whereas the initial extraction (following the provided consensus) had 'disableOffset' at Bit 0 and 'disableInternal' at Bit 14. Additionally, the field names 'maxFreqChangeRate' and 'maxPhaseCorrRate' were truncated to match the consensus instead of the full names shown in the PDF.

fields.name: maxFreqChangeRate
fields.description: Maximum frequency change rate during disciplining. Must not exceed 30ppb/s

fields.name: maxPhaseCorrRate
fields.description: Maximum phase correction rate in coherent time pulse mode. For maximum phase correction rate in corrective time pulse mode see maxSlewRate. Must not exceed 100ns/s

fields.name: reserved1
fields.description: Reserved

fields.description: Limit of possible deviation from nominal before UBX-TIM-TOS indicates that frequency is out of tolerance

fields.description: Limit of possible deviation from nominal before UBX-TIM-TOS indicates that time pulse is out of tolerance

fields.name: messageCfg
fields.description: Sync manager message configuration

bits.name: measInternal
bits.description: 1 = report the estimated offset of the internal oscillator based on the oscillator model

bits.name: measGNSS
bits.description: 1 = report the internal oscillator's offset relative to GNSS

bits.name: measEXTINT0
bits.description: 1 = report the internal oscillator's offset relative to the source on EXTINT0

bits.name: measEXTINT1
bits.description: 1 = report the internal oscillator's offset relative to the source on EXTINT1

fields.name: maxSlewRate
fields.description: Maximum slew rate applied between locked pulses in corrective time pulse mode.

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Flags

bits.name: disableInternal
bits.description: 1 = disable disciplining of the internal oscillator

bits.name: disableExternal
bits.description: 1 = disable disciplining of the external oscillator

bits.name: preferenceMode
bits.description: Reference selection preference (0: best frequency accuracy, 1: best phase accuracy)

bits.name: enableGNSS
bits.description: 1 = enable use of GNSS as synchronization source

bits.name: enableEXTINT0
bits.description: 1 = enable use of EXTINT0 as synchronization source

bits.name: enableEXTINT1
bits.description: 1 = enable use of EXTINT1 as synchronization source

bits.name: enableHostMeasInt
bits.description: 1 = enable use of host measurements on the internal oscillator

bits.name: enableHostMeasExt
bits.description: 1 = enable use of host measurements on the external oscillator

bits.name: useAnyFix
bits.description: 0 - use over-determined navigation solutions only, 1 - use any fix

bits.name: disableMaxSlewRate
bits.description: 0 - use maxSlewRate, 1 - don't use maxSlewRate

bits.name: issueFreqWarning
bits.description: 1 = issue a warning when frequency uncertainty exceeds freqTolerance

bits.name: issueTimeWarning
bits.description: 1 = issue a warning when time uncertainty exceeds timeTolerance

bits.name: TPCoherent
bits.description: Control time pulse coherency (0: Coherent, 1: Non-coherent, 2: Post-initialization coherent)

bits.name: disableOffset
bits.description: 1 = disable automatic storage of oscillator offset
